cards.back: Every view has one in the vertical and horizontal direction

cards.front: If you do not specify constraints on a view that explicitly determine the width or height.
cards.back: The view will derive its width or height from it intrinsic content size

cards.front: Implicit constraints are derived from a views.
cards.back: content hugging priorities and content compression resistance priorities.
horizontal content hugging priority, vertical content hugging priority, horizontal content compression resistance priority, vertical content compression resistance priority

cards.front: Content hugging and compression priorities can range in value from:

cards.back: how much a view resists getting bigger that is intrinsic content size
How much a view resists getting smaller than its intrinsic content size

cards.front: A content hugging priority of 1000 means
cards.back: View cannot get bigger that is intrinsic content size on that dimension(vertical or horizontal).

cards.front: A content compression priority of 1000 means
cards.back: View cannot get smaller that is intrinsic content size on that dimension.

cards.front: Ambiguous layout occurs when between 2 views.
cards.back: If the priority is the same.
